question: Which company has signed a deal with Ministry of Defence to supply simulators for gunnery and missile firing from BMP II vehicles to Indian Army?
explanation: Alpha Design Technologies Ltd. has signed Rs. 45-crore deal with Ministry of Defence to supply indigenous simulators for gunnery and missile firing from BMP II vehicles to Indian Army. Under this deal, as many as 57 simulators will be manufactured at company's Bengaluru facility and will be supplied to Indian Army over two years period. The BMP II is a Soviet-origin amphibious infantry fighting vehicle. The simulators will be used to train missile firing personnel. Currently, Indian Army firing personnel train fully on actual BMP vehicles. The use of simulators will save vehicle wear and tear to large extent.
